result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian R Gaeth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Collections may include income assignment.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brian R Gaeth in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge.  Court imposed the following sentence:  

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   


3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  - 18 months OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 months months OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

  -  TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*DRIVER'S LICENSE REVOCATION:  36 MONTHS
*IID: 36 MONTHS
FINE AND COURT COSTS:  $1519.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DNA SURCHARGE is waived. 

CONDITION TIME: 12 MONTHS county jail with huber for employment/school (CREDIT TIME OF: 171 days)

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Apply any bail that is posted.
